1 'use strict';
  2 
  3 var _ = require('underscore');
  4 
  5 // port from browserify path module
  6 // since react-native packager won't shim node modules.
  7 function extname(path) {
  8   return path.match(/^(\/?|)([\s\S]*?)((?:\.{1,2}|[^\/]+?|)(\.[^.\/]*|))(?:[\/]*)$/)[4];
  9 }
 10 
 11 /*jshint bitwise:false *//*global FileReader: true, File: true */
 12 module.exports = function(AV) {
 13   var b64Digit = function(number) {
 14     if (number < 26) {
 15       return String.fromCharCode(65 + number);
 16     }
 17     if (number < 52) {
 18       return String.fromCharCode(97 + (number - 26));
 19     }
 20     if (number < 62) {
 21       return String.fromCharCode(48 + (number - 52));
 22     }
 23     if (number === 62) {
 24       return "+";
 25     }
 26     if (number === 63) {
 27       return "/";
 28     }
 29     throw "Tried to encode large digit " + number + " in base64.";
 30   };
 31 
 32   var encodeBase64 = function(array) {
 33     var chunks = [];
 34     chunks.length = Math.ceil(array.length / 3);
 35     _.times(chunks.length, function(i) {
 36       var b1 = array[i * 3];
 37       var b2 = array[i * 3 + 1] || 0;
 38       var b3 = array[i * 3 + 2] || 0;
 39 
 40       var has2 = (i * 3 + 1) < array.length;
 41       var has3 = (i * 3 + 2) < array.length;
 42 
 43       chunks[i] = [
 44         b64Digit((b1 >> 2) & 0x3F),
 45         b64Digit(((b1 << 4) & 0x30) | ((b2 >> 4) & 0x0F)),
 46         has2 ? b64Digit(((b2 << 2) & 0x3C) | ((b3 >> 6) & 0x03)) : "=",
 47         has3 ? b64Digit(b3 & 0x3F) : "="
 48       ].join("");
 49     });
 50     return chunks.join("");
 51   };
 52

253   /**
254    * Reads a File using a FileReader.
255    * @param file {File} the File to read.
256    * @param type {String} (optional) the mimetype to override with.
257    * @return {AV.Promise} A Promise that will be fulfilled with a
258    *     base64-encoded string of the data and its mime type.
259    */
260   var readAsync = function(file, type) {
261     var promise = new AV.Promise();
262 
263     if (typeof(FileReader) === "undefined") {
264       return AV.Promise.error(new AV.Error(
265           -1, "Attempted to use a FileReader on an unsupported browser."));
266     }
267 
268     var reader = new FileReader();
269     reader.onloadend = function() {
270       if (reader.readyState !== 2) {
271         promise.reject(new AV.Error(-1, "Error reading file."));
272         return;
273       }
274 
275       var dataURL = reader.result;
276       var matches = /^data:([^;]*);base64,(.*)$/.exec(dataURL);
277       if (!matches) {
278         promise.reject(
279             new AV.Error(-1, "Unable to interpret data URL: " + dataURL));
280         return;
281       }
282 
283       promise.resolve(matches[2], type || matches[1]);
284     };
285     reader.readAsDataURL(file);
286     return promise;
287   };
288 
289   /**
290    * A AV.File is a local representation of a file that is saved to the AV
291    * cloud.
292    * @param name {String} The file's name. This will change to a unique value
293    *     once the file has finished saving.
294    * @param data {Array} The data for the file, as either:
295    *     1. an Array of byte value Numbers, or
296    *     2. an Object like { base64: "..." } with a base64-encoded String.
297    *     3. a File object selected with a file upload control. (3) only works
298    *        in Firefox 3.6+, Safari 6.0.2+, Chrome 7+, and IE 10+.
299    *        For example:<pre>
300    *     4.a Buffer object in Node.js runtime.
301    * var fileUploadControl = $("#profilePhotoFileUpload")[0];
302    * if (fileUploadControl.files.length > 0) {
303    *   var file = fileUploadControl.files[0];
304    *   var name = "photo.jpg";
305    *   var parseFile = new AV.File(name, file);
306    *   parseFile.save().then(function() {
307    *     // The file has been saved to AV.
308    *   }, function(error) {
309    *     // The file either could not be read, or could not be saved to AV.
310    *   });
311    * }</pre>
312    *
313    * @class
314    * @param type {String} Optional Content-Type header to use for the file. If
315    *     this is omitted, the content type will be inferred from the name's
316    *     extension.
317    */
318   AV.File = function(name, data, type) {
319     this._name = name;
320     var currentUser;
321     try {
322       currentUser = AV.User.current();
323     }
324     catch (e) {
325       console.warn('Get current user failed. It seems this runtime use an async storage system, please new AV.File in the callback of AV.User.currentAsync().');
326     }
327     this._metaData = {
328        owner: (currentUser != null ? currentUser.id : 'unknown')
329     };
330 
331     // Guess the content type from the extension if we need to.
332     var extension = /\.([^.]*)$/.exec(name);
333     if (extension) {
334       extension = extension[1].toLowerCase();
335     }
336     var guessedType = type || mimeTypes[extension] || "text/plain";
337     this._guessedType = guessedType;
338 
339     if (_.isArray(data)) {
340       this._source = AV.Promise.as(encodeBase64(data), guessedType);
341       this._metaData.size = data.length;
342     } else if (data && data.base64) {
343       var parseBase64 = require('./browserify-wrapper/parse-base64');
344       var dataBase64 = parseBase64(data.base64, guessedType);
345       this._source = AV.Promise.as(dataBase64, guessedType);
346     } else if (data && data.blob) {
347       this._source = AV.Promise.as(data.blob, guessedType);
348     } else if (typeof(File) !== "undefined" && data instanceof File) {
349       this._source = AV.Promise.as(data, guessedType);
350     } else if(AV._isNode && global.Buffer.isBuffer(data)) {
351       // use global.Buffer to prevent browserify pack Buffer module
352       this._source = AV.Promise.as(data.toString('base64'), guessedType);
353       this._metaData.size = data.length;
354     } else if (_.isString(data)) {
355       throw "Creating a AV.File from a String is not yet supported.";
356     }
357   };
358 
359   /**
360    * Creates a fresh AV.File object with exists url for saving to AVOS Cloud.
361    * @param {String} name the file name
362    * @param {String} url the file url.
363    * @param {Object} metaData the file metadata object,it's optional.
364    * @param {String} Optional Content-Type header to use for the file. If
365    *     this is omitted, the content type will be inferred from the name's
366    *     extension.
367    * @return {AV.File} the file object
368    */
369   AV.File.withURL = function(name, url, metaData, type){
370     if(!name || !url){
371       throw "Please provide file name and url";
372     }
373     var file = new AV.File(name, null, type);
374     //copy metaData properties to file.
375     if(metaData){
376       for(var prop in metaData){
377         if(!file._metaData[prop])
378           file._metaData[prop] = metaData[prop];
379       }
380     }
381     file._url = url;
382     //Mark the file is from external source.
383     file._metaData['__source'] = 'external';
384     return file;
385   };
386 
387   /**
388    * Creates a file object with exists objectId.
389    * @param {String} objectId The objectId string
390    * @return {AV.File} the file object
391    */
392   AV.File.createWithoutData = function(objectId){
393     var file = new AV.File();
394     file.id = objectId;
395     return file;
396   };
397 
398   AV.File.prototype = {
399 
400     toJSON: function() {
401       return AV._encode(this);
402     },
403 
404     /**
405      * Returns the ACL for this file.
406      * @returns {AV.ACL} An instance of AV.ACL.
407      */
408     getACL: function() {
409       return this._acl;
410     },
411 
412     /**
413      * Sets the ACL to be used for this file.
414      * @param {AV.ACL} acl An instance of AV.ACL.
415      */
416     setACL: function(acl) {
417         if(!(acl instanceof AV.ACL)) {
418           return new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
419                                "ACL must be a AV.ACL.");
420         }
421         this._acl = acl;
422     },
423 
424     /**
425      * Gets the name of the file. Before save is called, this is the filename
426      * given by the user. After save is called, that name gets prefixed with a
427      * unique identifier.
428      */
429     name: function() {
430       return this._name;
431     },
432 
433     /**
434      * Gets the url of the file. It is only available after you save the file or
435      * after you get the file from a AV.Object.
436      * @return {String}
437      */
438     url: function() {
439       return this._url;
440     },
441 
442     /**
443     * <p>Returns the file's metadata JSON object if no arguments is given.Returns the
444     * metadata value if a key is given.Set metadata value if key and value are both given.</p>
445     * <p><pre>
446     *  var metadata = file.metaData(); //Get metadata JSON object.
447     *  var size = file.metaData('size');  // Get the size metadata value.
448     *  file.metaData('format', 'jpeg'); //set metadata attribute and value.
449     *</pre></p>
450     * @return {Object} The file's metadata JSON object.
451     * @param {String} attr an optional metadata key.
452     * @param {Object} value an optional metadata value.
453     **/
454     metaData: function(attr, value) {
455       if(attr != null && value != null){
456          this._metaData[attr] = value;
457          return this;
458       }else if(attr != null){
459          return this._metaData[attr];
460       }else{
461         return this._metaData;
462       }
463     },
464 
465    /**
466     * URL
467     * @return {String} URL
468     * @param {Number} width 
469     * @param {Number} heigth 
470     * @param {Number} quality 1-100100
471     * @param {Number} scaleToFit true
472     * @param {String} fmt pngjpeg,gif
473     */
474    thumbnailURL: function(width, height, quality, scaleToFit, fmt){
475      if(!this.url()){
476        throw "Invalid url.";
477      }
478      if(!width || !height || width<=0 || height <=0 ){
479        throw "Invalid width or height value.";
480      }
481      quality = quality || 100;
482      scaleToFit = (scaleToFit == null) ? true: scaleToFit;
483      if(quality<=0 || quality>100){
484        throw "Invalid quality value.";
485      }
486      fmt = fmt || 'png';
487      var mode = scaleToFit ? 2: 1;
488      return this.url() + '?imageView/' + mode + '/w/' + width + '/h/' + height
489        + '/q/' + quality + '/format/' + fmt;
490    },
491 
492     /**
493     * Returns the file's size.
494     * @return {Number} The file's size in bytes.
495     **/
496     size: function(){
497       return this.metaData().size;
498     },
499 
500     /**
501      * Returns the file's owner.
502      * @return {String} The file's owner id.
503      */
504     ownerId: function(){
505       return this.metaData().owner;
506     },
507      /**
508      * Destroy the file.
509      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the destroy
510      *     completes.
511      */
512     destroy: function(options){
513       if(!this.id)
514         return AV.Promise.error('The file id is not eixsts.')._thenRunCallbacks(options);
515       var request = AV._request("files", null, this.id, 'DELETE');
516       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
517     },
518 
519     /**
520      * Request Qiniu upload token
521      * @param {string} type
522      * @return {AV.Promise} Resolved with the response
523      * @private
524      */
525     _qiniuToken: function(type) {
526       var self = this;
527       //Create 16-bits uuid as qiniu key.
528       var extName = extname(self._name);
529       var hexOctet = function() {
530         return Math.floor((1+Math.random())*0x10000).toString(16).substring(1);
531       };
532       var key = hexOctet() + hexOctet() + hexOctet() + hexOctet() + hexOctet()
533           + extName;
534 
535       var data = {
536         key: key,
537         ACL: self._acl,
538         name:self._name,
539         mime_type: type,
540         metaData: self._metaData
541       };
542       if(type && self._metaData.mime_type == null)
543         self._metaData.mime_type = type;
544       self._qiniu_key = key;
545       return AV._request("qiniu", null, null, 'POST', data);
546     },
547 
548     /**
549      * @callback UploadProgressCallback
550      * @param {XMLHttpRequestProgressEvent} event - The progress event with 'loaded' and 'total' attributes
551      */
552     /**
553      * Saves the file to the AV cloud.
554      * @param {Object} saveOptions
555      * @param {UploadProgressCallback} [saveOptions.onProgress]
556      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style options object.
557      * @return {AV.Promise} Promise that is resolved when the save finishes.
558      */
559     save: function() {
560       var options = null;
561       var saveOptions = {};
562       if(arguments.length === 1) {
563         options = arguments[0];
564       } else if(arguments.length === 2) {
565         saveOptions = arguments[0];
566         options = arguments[1];
567       }
568       var self = this;
569       if (!self._previousSave) {
570         if(self._source) {
571           var upload = require('./browserify-wrapper/upload');
572           upload(self, AV, saveOptions);
573         } else if(self._url && self._metaData['__source'] == 'external') {
574           //external link file.
575           var data = {
576             name: self._name,
577             ACL: self._acl,
578             metaData: self._metaData,
579             mime_type: self._guessedType,
580             url: self._url
581           };
582           self._previousSave = AV._request("files", self._name, null, 'POST', data).then(function(response) {
583             self._name = response.name;
584             self._url = response.url;
585             self.id = response.objectId;
586             if(response.size) {
587               self._metaData.size = response.size;
588             }
589             return self;
590           });
591         }
592       }
593       return self._previousSave._thenRunCallbacks(options);
594     }
595   };
596 
597 };
598
